repository.corpname: Archives of African American Music and Culture

did.unittitle: Murray Forman Collection of Hip Hop Magazines
did.abstract: Magazines and articles collected by Murray Forman during research for his book, The 'Hood Comes First: Race, Space, and Place in Rap and Hip-Hop (Wesleyan University, 2002).

defitem.item: Series 1: Magazines (alphabetical by publication title, then chronological)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Murray Forman, a media studies and culture scholar, received his PhD in Communication Studies from McGill University and is a significant contributor to hip hop scholarship. His first book, The 'Hood Comes First: Race, Space and Place in Rap and Hip-Hop, was published in 2002. He also edited That's the Joint!: The Hip-Hop Studies Reader (Routledge, 2004) and authored One Night on TV is Worth Weeks at the Paramount: Popular Music on Early Television (Duke University Press, 2012). Forman was an inaugural recipient of the Nasir Jones Hip-Hop Fellowship at the Hip-Hop Archive, the Hutchins Center for African and African American research, Harvard University for the year of 2014-2015. He is currently professor of Media and Screen Studies at Northeastern University.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Use of time-based media materials (audio and video) may require production of listening or viewing copies.

Access to streaming audio, moving image, and full resolution digital image materials may currently be restricted to researchers who can authenticate with an IU account or who are physically present on campus. Remote streaming to individual researchers may be allowed with the completion of applicable forms.
For further information about access to online audiovisual materials, contact AAAMC staff at aaamc@indiana.edu.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Manuscript collections and archival records may contain materials with sensitive or confidential information that is protected under federal or state right to privacy laws and regulations, including but not limited to the Indiana Public Records Act (5-14-3-2 et seq.). Researchers are advised that the disclosure of certain information pertaining to identifiable living individuals represented in this collection without the consent of those individuals may have legal ramifications (e.g., a cause of action under common law for invasion of privacy may arise if facts concerning an individual's private life are published that would be deemed highly offensive to a reasonable person) for which Indiana University assumes no responsibility.

Copyright is retained by the creators/authors of items in this collection, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law. All requests for copying and publishing materials must be submitted in writing to the Archives of African American Music and Culture, and may require the written permission of the creator(s)/author(s) or donor(s).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Murray Forman Collection of Hip Hop Magazines, SC 139, Archives of African American Music and Culture, Indiana University, Bloomington.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by AAAMC Staff. Completed in 2019.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional issues of Rap Pages, Rap Sheet, and XXL are available in AAAMC general periodical collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Magazines and articles collected by Murray Forman during research for his book, The 'Hood Comes First: Race, Space, and Place in Rap and Hip-Hop (Wesleyan University, 2002). Series 1 contains hip hop periodicals and feature articles published from 1989-2006, including a nearly complete run of The Source, as well as various issues of Blaze, Hip-Hop Connection, Hip-Hop Weekly, Rap Masters, Rap Pages, Rap Sheet, Rappin', Spin, Vibe, and XXL. Also included are articles related to hip hop from mainstream magazines such as Ebony, Forbes, Newsweek, Rolling Stone, and Time. The summaries of the content and featured artists are meant to provide a broad overview for research purposes and should not be considered a complete index of the contents. Series 2 includes Billboard Chart Ratings from 1978-1998.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Serial titles with more than six issues may have been have been transferred to the AAAMC's general periodical collection.
